alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 8:45AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN COUNTY THROUGH 915 AM EDT... At 844 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Lake Santee, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Brookville, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Metamora, St. Leon, Cedar Grove, Mount Carmel, Mounds State Recreation Area, Huntersville, Hamburg, Rockdale, Mixersville, Peppertown, Sharptown, New Trenton, Saint Peter and Buena Vista. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 148. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
